desc: i am working in a RPG game that is based on theories related to quantum physics and space/time travels,  that require realistic "futuristic"/"space armored"  humans as (Halo or similars) characters but in the head just with some kind of googles/othersi will need a 2d/3d character creator/animator, to create the 2d sprites for my project,i will start with the demo, so i just need one character with basic movements, then after my project is approve, i will need the same animator to generate 20 to 30 additional characters/enemies.requirements..+character type: similar to armor as Halo/Raiden from Metal gear (i personally don't like Halo suits for this game so try something not so Halo)+perspective: sprites to be similar angle to RPG 2d games as old Final fantasy+2 to 6 frames per animation:- 1 x static, 1 x running, 2 x attacking (using a illuminated blade gun or similars), 1 x receiving a hit, 1 x dead and 1 x blocking- size, between 100 to 150 pixels height     (human must fit in this height)- width depending on the type of animation- and maybe capability to export some time the same version at 300 pixel heightNote: i am looking for a draft version of the character with not so much details and low resolutions textures (if is a 3d model), that may require extra hours to get final version of this model.finally: it will be necessary at some point provide the quote for the additional 20 to 30 characters/equipment/items that will be required later.Note: make sure that experience with 2d games are necessary as i am not looking for a extreme detailed 3d character that i will dream with use it but then when exported to a 2d in the 100 -150 pixel resolutions it will looks like a blurred object without details

desc: Landing page of our website shows banner that our office is closed. Its background is the photographic interior of our office (spacious, with pillars, furniture, doors in back middle). Your cursor/pointer is “holding” a beaker of orange chemicals. The game has started. Within seconds you see a person – may be photograph or may be artistic hand-drawn version , either way these are cutout portraits of real people – running with low-fi, Jib-Jab style animation slowly across the screen. The runner passes behind pillars and furniture and may disappear for seconds at a time. Its objective is clearly the front doors, and you click your mouse near the running character. The orange beaker arcs and spins above the cursor location, shrinking with distance perspective and then gravity arcs it downward and it smashes against whatever background object  is at the click point. You may need to define regions of the photograph and tag their distance from viewer; or paint that information into a hidden layer, or something. New people emerge from behind pillars or stairs and run quickly to a new hiding spot, or for the front doors and possible escape. If one reaches the front door, it opens and slams shut and you lose 1 Director (large temp caption on screen). If the orange splatter hits a Mole, show an unpleasant death animation; as many as 5 variant death types. Each time you throw a beaker, the scene becomes more scattered with broken glass, orange slime, and destruction. Sounds and cutout graphics should be implemented, but must be easily customisable (replaceable) by us. We also may want to add/modify/position text inserts
title: Create a Whack-a-mole style browser game -- 2
